service

Class EncryptionService

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.EncryptionService

  • public class EncryptionService
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Description: Class that contains methods that hash passwords, encrypt/decrypt files, and encrypt/decrypt String inputs for transit and security.
    Author:
    Cesar Guzman, Jesse Goerzen, Taylor Hanlon, Tristen Kreutz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String cipherKeyAlgorithm
      The algorithm to generate SecretKey objects for use with Cipher objects.
      private static java.lang.String cipherTransform
      The type of transform for Cipher objects to use.
      private static java.lang.String encryptedFilesDirectory
      The directory in which to store encrypted files.
      private static boolean init
      Whether the encryption constants have been initialized from the config or not.
      private static int iterationCount
      The number of iterations of the algorithm to perform.
      private static java.lang.String keyAlgorithm
      The algorithm to generate SecretKey objects.
      private static int keyLength
      The number of bytes in a key.
      private static java.lang.String keyPath
      The path to the file containing the key for file and string encryption and decryption.
      private static java.lang.String outputFilesDirectory
      The directory in which to store decrypted files.
      private static java.lang.String saltPath
      The path to the file containing the salt for file and string encryption and decryption.

        public EncryptionService()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private static void init()
                  throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                         ConfigException
        Initializes encryption constants from the config. Should be added to the beginning of each public method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        ConfigException - if the config file is missing from the res folder.

      • hash

        public static java.lang.String hash(java.lang.String toHash,
                                    java.lang.String salt)
                             throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                    ConfigException,
                                    java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                    java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Takes the String passed into the method and hashes it for security purposes.
        Parameters:
        toHash - The password or other String to create a hash for.
        salt - The salt to be used in the hashing.
        Returns:
        The String of characters that is derived from the toHash and the salt.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res directory doesn't exist.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm in the config file isn't valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the toHash and salt is invalid.

      • encryptDocument

        public static Document encryptDocument(java.lang.String filepath)
                                throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                       ConfigException,
                                       java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                       javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                       java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                       java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Encrypts the file at the given filepath and returns a record of the document.
        Parameters:
        filepath - String The filepath of the file to encrypt.
        Returns:
        Document The record of the encrypted file.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res folder does not exist.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the padding of the cipher transform given in the config file is not valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the cipher transform is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher or if the key is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the key and the salt from the file are invalid.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key used in the cipher is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if the file at the given filepath does not exist or a file at the output directory cannot be created.

      • encryptDocument

        public static Document encryptDocument(java.io.InputStream in,
                                       java.lang.String fileName)
                                throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                       ConfigException,
                                       java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                       javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                       java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                       java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Encrypts the incoming stream as an encrypted document with the given name and returns a record of the document.
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream The input stream of the file to encrypt.
        fileName - String The name of the file to encrypt.
        Returns:
        Document The record of the encrypted file.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res folder does not exist.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the padding of the cipher transform given in the config file is not valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the cipher transform is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher or if the key is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the key and the salt from the file are invalid.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key used in the cipher is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if the file at the given filepath does not exist or a file at the output directory cannot be created.

      • decryptDocument

        public static java.lang.String decryptDocument(Document doc)
                                        throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                               ConfigException,
                                               java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                               java.io.IOException,
                                               java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                               javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                               java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                               java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                               java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Decrypts the given document and returns the filepath of the resulting file.
        Parameters:
        doc - Document The record of the encrypted file.
        Returns:
        String The filepath of the decrypted file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the given document is not present.
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the padding of the cipher transform given in the config file is not valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the cipher transform is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher or if the key is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res directory doesn't exist.
        java.io.IOException - if the file at the given filepath does not exist or a file at the output directory cannot be created.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the key and the salt from the file are invalid.
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the cipher IV at the beginning of the document is invalid.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key used in the cipher is invalid.

      • decryptDocument

        public static void decryptDocument(Document doc,
                                   java.io.OutputStream out)
                            throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                   ConfigException,
                                   java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   java.io.IOException,
                                   java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                   java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                   java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                   java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Decrypts the given document and sends the resulting file over the given stream.
        Parameters:
        doc - Document The record of the encrypted file.
        out - OutputStream The stream of data to send the decrypted file over.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the given document is not present.
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the padding of the cipher transform given in the config file is not valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the cipher transform is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher or if the key is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res directory doesn't exist.
        java.io.IOException - if the file at the given filepath does not exist or a file at the output directory cannot be created.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the key and the salt from the file are invalid.
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the cipher IV at the beginning of the document is invalid.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key used in the cipher is invalid.

      • encryptString

        public static java.lang.String encryptString(java.lang.String unencrypted)
                                      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                             ConfigException,
                                             java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                             javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                             java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                             java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                             javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                             javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Encrypts the given String object into an array of bytes. The resulting bytes cannot be safely saved as a String.
        Parameters:
        unencrypted - String The unencrypted String object.
        Returns:
        String The encrypted array of bytes in hexadecimal format.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res directory doesn't exist.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the padding of the cipher transform given in the config file is not valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the cipher transform is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher or if the key is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the key and the salt from the file are invalid.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key used in the cipher is invalid.
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - if the padding option in the config file is invalid.
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the block size generated by the Cipher object instance creator is invalid.

      • decryptString

        public static java.lang.String decryptString(java.lang.String encrypted)
                                      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                             ConfigException,
                                             java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                             javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                             java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                             java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                             java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                             javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                             javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Takes the String passed into the method and decrypts the String.
        Parameters:
        encrypted - String The string of bytes in hexadecimal to be decrypted. This string must have been produced by the encrpytString() method.
        Returns:
        decrypted String The decrypted String object.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res directory doesn't exist.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the padding of the cipher transform given in the config file is not valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the cipher transform is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher or if the key is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the initialization vector stored at the beginning of the byte array is invalid.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the key and the salt from the file are invalid.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key used in the cipher is invalid.
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - if the padding option in the config file is invalid.
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the block size generated by the Cipher object instance creator is invalid.

      • getSalt

        public static java.lang.String getSalt()
                                throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                       ConfigException
        Returns a random String object that is 32 characters long.
        Returns:
        a random String object that is 32 characters long.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res directory doesn't exist.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.

      • getCipher

        private static javax.crypto.Cipher getCipher()
                                      throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                             javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        Creates an instance of a Cipher object that follows the rules set out in the config.
        Returns:
        Cipher a Cipher object that follows the rules set out in the config.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the cipher transform is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the padding of the cipher transform given in the config file is not valid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher

      • getKey

        private static javax.crypto.SecretKey getKey(java.lang.String toHash,
                                             java.lang.String salt)
                                      throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                             java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                             ConfigException
        Creates an instance of a SecretKey object according to rules in the config file using the toHash and salt. The SecretKey object can be used to create a hashed password or a Cipher object.
        Parameters:
        toHash - String The unhashed key or password to be used to encrypt or decrypt data.
        salt - String The salt to be added to the key or password.
        Returns:
        SecretKey The desired SecretKey object.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm of the key is invalid according to https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SecretKeyFactory
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification created from the key and the salt are invalid.
        ConfigException - if the config file in the res directory doesn't exist.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if iterationCount or keyLength are not integers in the config file.

      • getEncryptedFilepath

        private static java.lang.String getEncryptedFilepath()
        Creates a valid filepath for encrypted files. The file name is random and unique and ends in the ".secure" extension
        Returns:
        String A random and unique filepath in the encrypted files directory.
